name: Huabing Xie

timeline.event: Arrested along U.S.-Mexico border
Released on order of recognizance after initial arrest
Detained at Imperial Regional Detention Facility
Had seizure while detained
Died at nearby hospital
ICE missed congressionally-mandated 90-day deadline to release death report

discrepancies.ice_claim: Death report to be released per congressional mandate
discrepancies.counter_evidence: ICE missed the congressionally-mandated 90-day deadline to release the death report

sources.title: ICE misses deadline to release report on in-custody death in Imperial County

notes: Age unknown at time of documentation. ICE failed to comply with congressionally-mandated reporting deadline.

name: Ismael Ayala-Uribe

timeline.event: Referred to local hospital
Died at nearby hospital

discrepancies.ice_claim: Detainee was referred to local hospital day prior to death
discrepancies.counter_evidence: Ayala-Uribe was a former DACA recipient, raising questions about his detention circumstances

sources.title: DACA Recipient Dies in Adelanto Detention
Mexican National Dies in ICE Custody After Being Referred to Local Hospital Day Prior

notes: Former DACA recipient. 14th death in ICE custody in 2025 at time of death. Adelanto facility operated by GEO Group.

notes: Autopsy pending at time of reporting

name: Jose Manuel Sanchez-Castro
official_cause_of_death: Under investigation by Pierce County Medical Examiner (suspected fentanyl withdrawal complications)

timeline.event: First entered U.S. illegally
Voluntarily deported to Mexico one week after first arrest
Caught illegally entering the country (8th time between 2009 and July 2024)
Arrived at Northwest ICE Processing Center, placed in medical isolation for fentanyl withdrawal
911 call at 7:05 AM for medical services - reported unresponsive but breathing
Pronounced dead
ICE releases identity of deceased

discrepancies.ice_claim: Detainee was placed in medical isolation for fentanyl withdrawal
discrepancies.counter_evidence: Advocacy group La Resistencia alleged ICE violated its own detention standards requiring immediate transfer to appropriate medical facility for 'severe, life-threatening intoxication or withdrawal symptoms'
Only 5 days elapsed between arrival at facility and death, raising questions about adequacy of withdrawal treatment protocols

sources.title: ICE releases identity of latest death at Tacoma detention center
Mexican National in ICE Custody Dies at NWIPC

notes: Had prior convictions for resisting arrest and manufacture/delivery of methamphetamine in Yakima County. This was the second death at Northwest ICE Processing Center in 2024.

name: Charles Leo Daniel
official_cause_of_death: Hypertensive and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ruled natural causes by Pierce County Medical Examiner)

timeline.event: Taken into ICE custody after serving approximately 16-year sentence for second-degree murder
Placed in solitary confinement due to mental health issues
Found unresponsive by staff at 10:43 AM
Pronounced dead approximately one hour after being found
Pierce County Medical Examiner releases cause of death

discrepancies.counter_evidence: Daniel was held in solitary confinement for nearly 4 years - one of the longest stays in isolation at any U.S. immigration facility. UN considers solitary confinement over 15 days to constitute torture.
Daniel had documented mental health issues including hearing voices, visual hallucinations, and delusions. He often refused medications. His prolonged isolation may have exacerbated his conditions.

sources.title: Police find man dead at Northwest ICE Processing Center in Tacoma
Medical examiner says death of ICE detainee at Tacoma facility was due to natural causes
Trinidad and Tobago National in ICE Custody Dies at NWIPC

notes: Death sparked hunger strikes by more than 160 detainees at the facility. ICE Detainee Death Report available at https://www.ice.gov/doclib/foia/reports/ddrDanielCharlesLeo.pdf
